titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New England Grenfell Association Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by William E. Brown, Jr.

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday March 9, 2019 at 08:00

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records include correspondence, minutes of meetings, office files, financial and legal papers, and memorabilia of the New England Grenfell Association, founded in 1914 to promote missionary and medical work in Labrador and Newfoundland.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: New England Grenfell Association Records (MS 1200). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of New England Grenfell Association, 1980.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The New England Grenfell Association was founded in 1914 in order to promote missionary and medical work in Labrador and Newfoundland, Canada.

The records include correspondence, minutes of meetings, office files, financial and legal papers, and memorabilia of the New England Grenfell Association. The records date from 1912 to 1978 and are arranged in fifteen boxes which total ten linear feet. The New England Grenfell Association donated the records in 1980.
The records are arranged in two series:

SERIES I consists of routine office correspondence, memoranda, and files relating to the daily operations of the association. The bulk of material concerns the financial operations of the organization including bequests, gifts, leases, and payrolls. Minutes of meetings of the Board of Directors are organized in folders 52-54 and these materials provide a detailed review of the activities and interests of the New England Grenfell Association.
SERIES II contains bound volumes of cash books, journals, and ledgers which provide detailed financial records for the transactions of the association.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in two series: I. Office Files. II. Financial Volumes.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
